backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor implementing tournament and user profile management with CRUD operations for tournaments, groups, and stages; includes authorization mixin and access control for user permissions.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting three high-confidence features related to restoring and fixing the TournamentListDialog component's tournament list display and state management issues.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Comprehensive summaries of all frontend source files including components, pages, stores, utilities, and tournament generation logic with details on functionality and recent fixes.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for light and dark themes, defining colors for UI elements including sidebar, charts, and semantic tokens.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for the React application with viewport meta tags and a descriptive title for the multi-stage cricket tournament draw app.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that renders AppHeader and conditionally displays pages (setup, schedule, fullSchedule, knockout, profile) based on currentView state from the tournament store, with toast notifications.
frontend/src/components/AdvancementConfi: Modal dialog component for configuring stage advancement rules, allowing users to set winner and runner-up destinations to next stages, knockout entry points, or elimination with validation and stage-aware options.
frontend/src/components/AppHeader.tsx: Application header component with Tournament Manager branding, profile navigation button, and login/logout authentication toggle using Internet Identity integration.
frontend/src/components/AppLayout.tsx: Shared layout wrapper providing responsive container with gradient background, consistent padding, and footer with caffeine.ai attribution and copyright notice.
frontend/src/components/DeleteTournament: A confirmation dialog component that handles tournament deletion with loading state, error handling, and success/error toasts using the useDeleteTournament mutation hook.
frontend/src/components/KnockoutPairingE: Manages knockout stage pairing configuration with auto/manual modes, displays qualified teams from group stages, allows manual fixture assignments, validates pairings for rematches, and shows warnings.
frontend/src/components/KnockoutWinnerSe: Renders winner selection buttons for knockout matches, hiding the selector when either team is a placeholder (TBD) and highlighting the currently selected winner.
frontend/src/components/MatchDateTimeEdi: Provides date and time input fields for editing match scheduling information, updating the tournament store on change.
frontend/src/components/NewTournamentBut: A button that resets the tournament state, showing a confirmation dialog if a tournament has already been generated to prevent accidental data loss.
frontend/src/components/RoundRobinGroupT: Displays round-robin groups in a grid layout with inline editing for team names, group names, and team positions, including validation and toast notifications.
frontend/src/components/SaveTournamentDi: A dialog for saving tournament configurations either as a new tournament or updating an existing one, serializing groups and stages and using mutation hooks to persist data.
frontend/src/components/Stage2GroupAssig: Visualizes the flow of teams between round-robin stages and knockout, showing winner and runner-up destinations with icons and badges for each stage.
frontend/src/components/TournamentListDi: Dialog component for managing tournaments with list view, inline rename, delete, and load functionality. Fetches all tournaments from backend and deserializes them into the tournament store.
frontend/src/components/UserTournamentCa: Card component displaying tournament summary (name, date, groups, stages) with a load button. Fetches full tournament data and deserializes it into the store on click.
frontend/src/features/tournament/deseria: Deserializes backend TournamentView into frontend tournament state including groups, stages, advancement configs, and round robin rounds. Handles both NextStage and KnockoutEntry advancement rules.
Frontend-only utility to export Robin Round 1 stage data (groups and teams) as a downloadable JSON file without backend calls.
frontend/src/features/tournament/generat: Generates multi-round tournament stages with deterministic seeding, creating groups with sequential naming and round-robin matches. Advances teams between stages based on advancement configs.
frontend/src/features/tournament/groupNa: Generates Excel-style alphabetical group names (A-Z, AA-AZ, BA-BZ, etc.) supporting unlimited groups across all robin rounds using base-26 naming.
frontend/src/features/tournament/groupRe: Reorders teams within a group by moving a team to a target position, maintaining unique positions 1..N through deterministic swapping.
frontend/src/features/tournament/knockou: Generates knockout fixture codes (PQ1, Q2, S1, F1) based on round name and match index within the round.
Generates knockout stage matches from qualified robin round teams with metadata tracking (winner/runner-up status, group origin). Implements pairing logic to avoid same-group matchups when possible.
Provides utilities to detect, normalize, and display placeholder team names (TBD, fixture codes like PQ1/Q2/S1/F1, or legacy 'Winner of X' patterns) in knockout brackets.
Implements knockout bracket reseeding logic that optimizes team placement to avoid rematches, same-group matchups, and winner-vs-winner pairings, with scoring and warning generation.
Defines canonical knockout round constants (Pre-Quarterfinal, Quarterfinal, Semifinal, Final) with utilities for ordering, validation, and determining the first enabled round.
Handles propagation of knockout match winners to downstream matches using stable upstream fixture references, and clears affected downstream winners when upstream results change.
frontend/src/features/tournament/matchCo: Calculates total match counts for tournaments, breaking down round-robin matches by stage/group and knockout matches by round based on configuration.
frontend/src/features/tournament/originG: Resolves a team's origin group serial (e.g., 'A-2') by finding the earliest stage where the team appears, used for display formatting in later stages.
frontend/src/features/tournament/qualifi: Computes qualified teams for knockout stages based on per-stage advancement configurations, determining which winners and runner-ups advance to which knockout entry points.
frontend/src/features/tournament/roundRo: Generates display codes for teams in round-robin matches (e.g., 'A1'), with special handling for Stage 2 that uses origin group serials with hyphens.
Generates all unique round-robin match pairings for a group by creating matches between every pair of teams.
frontend/src/features/tournament/seriali: Serializes frontend tournament stage and group data into backend-compatible types, converting advancement rules (NextStage, KnockoutEntry, Eliminated) and aggregating groups/stages with BigInt IDs.
frontend/src/features/tournament/types.t: Defines TypeScript types for tournament entities (Team, Group, Match, Stage) and configuration (advancement destinations, knockout stages, round-robin rounds, pairing modes, warnings, and the main TournamentState).
frontend/src/features/tournament/useTour: Zustand store managing tournament state with persistence, including team/match/stage management, knockout generation, reseeding, winner tracking, and migration logic for match source references.
frontend/src/features/tournament/validat: Validates tournament configuration inputs (team counts, group counts, round configs, advancement rules) and provides formatting utilities for displaying advancement destinations and stage labels.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React Query hook that creates and manages the backend actor instance, handling authentication via Internet Identity and invalidating dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides React context and hooks for Internet Identity authentication, managing login/logout flow, identity persistence, and delegation validity with configurable AuthClient options.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Custom React Query hooks for tournament CRUD operations (get, create, update, delete tournaments/groups/stages) and user profile management, with automatic cache invalidation.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for light and dark themes, defining colors for UI components like backgrounds, borders, buttons, and charts.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React root with QueryClient for data fetching and InternetIdentityProvider for authentication, then renders the App component.
frontend/src/pages/FullSchedulePage.tsx: Displays complete tournament schedule including round-robin and knockout stages with match details, winner selection, and save functionality requiring Internet Identity authentication.
frontend/src/pages/KnockoutPage.tsx: Manages knockout stage view with match brackets organized by rounds, winner selection, validation of qualified team counts, and tournament reset functionality.
frontend/src/pages/StageSchedulePage.tsx: Displays round-robin group stages with editable group and team names, provides navigation to full schedule view, and includes reset functionality with confirmation dialog.
frontend/src/pages/TournamentSetupPage.t: Main tournament configuration page for setting team count, round-robin rounds, group counts, advancement rules, knockout stages, and generating tournaments with validation and save/load capabilities.
frontend/src/pages/UserProfilePage.tsx: User profile management page displaying username, join date, privacy settings, and user's tournaments list, requiring Internet Identity authentication to access.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for extracting, storing, and managing URL parameters from both regular query strings and hash-based routing, with sessionStorage persistence support.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining custom color scheme using OKLCH color space, container settings, border radius variables, custom animations, and typography/container-queries/animate plugins.
project_state.json: Project state tracking a fix request for a blank screen issue in the tournament list display (Draft 47) caused by broken clickable tournament names functionality and frontend state management problems.
